summary: A joule  is a unit in the SI system.
full_text:
The joule , symbol J, is a derived unit of energy in the International System of Units. It is equal to the energy transferred  to an object when a force of one newton acts on that object in the direction of its motion through a distance of one metre . It is also the energy dissipated as heat when an electric current of one ampere passes through a resistance of one ohm for one second. It is named after the English physicist James Prescott Joule .

One joule can also be defined as:
The work required to move an electric charge of one coulomb through an electrical potential difference of one volt, or one '"coulomb volt" . This relationship can be used to define the volt.
The work required to produce one watt of power for one second, or one "watt second"  . This relationship can be used to define the watt.
